title: FPV
description: First person view. Refers to the way the video feed from the drone looks.

title: vtx
description: Video transmitter. The module that takes your FPV camera feed and transmits it over (usually) 5.8GHz to your goggles or other video receiver.
author: Georgi

title: receiver
description: Usually refers to the radio receiver module on the drone. This is the unit that receives commands from your radio transmitter (controller).

title: transmitter
description: Your radio transmitter controller. The unit that sends instructions over (usually) 2.4GHz to the receiver on the drone

author: Power_FPV
description: Slang for abandoned building. Very popular for both racing and freestyle pilots
title: Bando

author: Power_FPV
description: Abbreviation for Crossfire, a long range 868mhz/915mhz radio protocol
title: XF

author: Power_FPV
description: Slang for Lithium Polymer battery. 99.99% of fpv quads run LiPo batteries due to their high density, light weight and power output.
title: LiPo

author: Power_FPV
description: Stands for Flight Controller. The main "brain" of the quadcopter that takes radio input from the receiver, signal from gyroscopes and accelerometers, and controls the angle of the drone.
title: FC

author: Power_FPV
description: Abbreviation for On Screen Display. This overlays important flight statistics (battery voltage, RSSI, altitude etc.) On the FPV feed.
title: OSD

author: Power_FPV
description: Dshot is a digital protocol for communication between the flight controller and ESC's
title: Dshot
